title: Spill gates of several reservoirs opened due to heavy rainfall
byline: Four spill gates of Deduru Oya reservoir have been opened due to heavy rainfall in catchment areas.

title: Brazil’s ex-president Bolsonaro detained by police ahead of vigil
byline: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro was taken into federal police custody on Saturday before a planned supporters’ vigil near his home, ending months of house arrest as he appeals a Supreme Court conviction for plotting a coup.

title: Section of Kandy–Colombo Road to remain closed until further notice due to landslide in Ganethenna
byline: A section of the Kandy–Colombo main road in the Ganethenna area of Pahala Kadugannawa which was cordoned off this morning (22), following the landslide near the Ganethenna Junction, will remain closed until further notice.

title: Every citizen of this country must be allowed to live freely -President
byline: Every citizen of this country must be allowed to live freely, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized during a discussion held at the Presidential Secretariat today (22).

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: Prevailing showery condition over the island is expected to continue further during the next few days, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: COP30 seals uneasy climate deal that sidesteps fossil fuels
byline: Brazil’s COP30 presidency pushed through a compromise climate deal on Saturday that would boost finance for poor nations coping with global warming but that omitted any mention of the fossil fuels driving it.

title: Woman hacked to death over personal dispute in Pottuvil
byline: A woman has been reportedly hacked to death using a mammoty in the 12th post area of Hulannuge in Pottuvil.

title: Flood warnings issued for low-lying areas of Deduru Oya and Attanagalu Oya
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued a warning of potential flooding situation in several low-lying areas of Deduru Oya and Aththanagalu Oya Basin.

title: Kadugannawa Landslide: Army engaged in restoration activities, police issue alternative routes
byline: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO) states that the Sri Lanka Army in Beragala is currently engaged in restoring the area affected by the landslide that occurred in Pahala Kadugannawa yesterday (22) to its normal condition.

title: Commuters to pay bus fares using bank cards from tomorrow
byline: Commuters will be able to pay bus fares using bank-issued credit and debit cards on buses equipped with ticket-issuing machines with effect from tomorrow (24).

title: Thousands of Australians without power after tropical cyclone hits Northern Territory
byline: Thousands of people in Australia’s Northern Territory were without power on Sunday after a tropical cyclone brought destructive winds to the region, including capital Darwin, overnight.

title: Titanic passenger’s watch fetches record price at auction
byline: A gold pocket watch recovered from the body of one of the richest passengers on the Titanic has fetched a “record-breaking” £1.78m at auction.

title: Over 1,000 arrested in “Nation United” island-wide anti-drug raids
byline: More than 1,000 individuals have been arrested yesterday (22),  during the nationwide operation launched to eradicate drugs from the country under the theme “Nation United – National Drive”, aimed at eradicating narcotics from the country.

title: Locomotive Engineers to halt train services from Mahawa over elephant-train collisions
byline: The Locomotive Operating Engineers’ Union has announced that goods and fuel trains operating from Mahawa to Trincomalee, Batticaloa, and Kankesanthurai will be withdrawn from service.

title: Death toll due to adverse weather climbs to 09 across the island
byline: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) states that the death toll due to adverse weather conditions has risen to nine.

title: Youth arrested with more than 1kg of Ice in Madampitiya
byline: A youth has been arrested for the possession of more than one kilogram of crystal methamphetamine at the Mihijaya Sewana Housing Scheme in Madampitiya, police stated.

title: Two dead in separate road accidents
byline: An individual has died in a road accident that occurred along the Ratnapura – Embilipitiya road in Udawalawa, police stated.

title: Canada says it will resume US trade talks ‘when appropriate’
byline: Canada will resume trade discussions with the United States “when it’s appropriate,” Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said on Sunday, noting he did not have a pressing issue to address with President Donald Trump.

title: Sri Lanka stands ready to deepen cooperation with China – FM
byline: Sri Lanka stands ready to deepen cooperation with China based on equality and mutual respect, Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath stated.

title: Heavy showers above 100mm likely at some places this evening
byline: An ‘Amber’ level advisory for heavy rains has been issued until 8.30 a.m. tomorrow (24), by the Department of Meteorology.

title: Myanmar says nearly 1,600 foreigners arrested in scam hub raids
byline: Myanmar’s military said on Sunday (Nov 23) it arrested nearly 1,600 foreign nationals in five days in a highly publicised crackdown on a notorious internet scam hub on the Thai border.

title: Over 132,000 tourists arrive in November
byline: A total of 132,783 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in November, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Complaint lodged with CID over reports that A/L question paper was leaked
byline: The Department of Examinations has lodged a complaint with the Criminal Investigation Department requesting an investigation into reports claiming that the Economics question paper of this year’s GCE Advanced Level examination had been leaked prior to the exam.

title: Scientists warn modern city life may harm human health and reproductive functions
byline: Living in modern cities may not be good for human health, according to evolutionary scientists from Loughborough University in England and the University of Zurich in Switzerland.

title: Landslide warnings issued for residents of 12 districts extended
byline: Early landslide warnings issued to residents of multiple areas in 12 districts owing to incessant rains experienced in parts of the island, have been extended.

title: Special transport arrangements for A/L candidates facing disaster-related disruptions
byline: The Disaster Management Centre, in coordination with the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB), has arranged a special transportation plan to assist Advanced Level examination candidates who are facing travel difficulties, following yesterday’s landslide in Pahala Kadugannawa.

title: Advisory issued for strong winds, heavy showers and rough seas
byline: A low-pressure area has formed over the South Andaman Sea area and is likely to move northwestwards and intensify into a depression over the South-east Bay of Bengal tomorrow, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Landslide in Pahala Kadugannawa not a risk to wider region - NBRO
byline: The landslide occurred yesterday in Pahala Kadugannawa is a localized risk confined to the immediate site and does not pose a threat to the wider region, Dr. Gamini Jayatissa, the Director of the Landslide Research and Study Division of the National Building Research Organisation stated.

title: Pahala Kadugannawa Landslide: Alternative routes announced for students travelling to A/L exam centres
byline: Alternative routes and emergency contact numbers have been issued to students travelling to their Advanced Level examination centres tomorrow (24), as well as for relevant officials, following yesterday’s landslide in Pahala Kadugannawa.

title: Israel PM Netanyahu vows to keep striking Hamas and Hezbollah
byline: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu insisted on Sunday (Nov 23) that Israel would do “everything necessary” to stop Hezbollah from regrouping in Lebanon and Hamas from doing the same in Gaza.

title: Special guidelines issued for A/L students traveling from Kegalle and Mawanella to Kandy
byline: Students from Kegalle and Mawanella, who are required to sit for the Advanced Level examinations at centres located in and around the Kandy city, will be allowed to sit the exam at the nearest examination centre if they face severe difficulties in reaching their assigned centres, Kegalle District Secretary Jagath M. Herath has stated.

title: Canada to revise law for citizenship by descent
byline: Canada is set to modernise its citizenship rules, which could benefit thousands of Indian-origin families and other Canadians born abroad.

title: Several trapped after tree falls on three-wheeler in Rambukkana
byline: A large tree has fallen onto a three-wheeler traveling along the Mawanella–Rambukkana road this evening (23), police stated.

title: Malaysian national arrested at BIA with around 5kg of cocaine
byline: A Malaysian national has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport while attempting to smuggle around 5kg of cocaine into the island.

title: UN Security Council reforms no longer an option, but a necessity: Modi
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday made a strong pitch for reforms of the UN Security Council, asserting that the India-Brazil-South Africa troika should send a clear message that changes to institutions of global governance were no longer an option, but a necessity.
